btClient

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • btClient.Piece

  • public class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is tasked with managing a single piece of the downloaded file. This includes writing blocks to the file and checking the piece's completeness and computing the piece's hash when complete
    Author:
    Cody

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Block> blocks
      An array list of Block objects associated with this piece
      private boolean complete
      true if all blocks are downloaded (all values in boolean [] blocks are true)
      private int downloadAttempts
      Number of times this piece has been downloaded (piece gets redownloaded if hash doesn't match when complete)
      private java.io.RandomAccessFile file
      The file where the downloaded data is to be saved
      private byte[] hash
      The SHA-1 hash of this piece (only available once piece is completed)
      private int index
      The zero based index corresponding to the position of this piece in the overall file
      private int numBlocks
      The number of blocks in this piece
      private int offset
      Starting position of this piece in the output file
      private int peerCount 
      private int size
      The total size of the piece in bytes

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkComplete()
      Sets the complete value by checking if all blocks are downloaded
      boolean checkHash() 
      boolean checkHash(byte[] hash)
      Checks if a given hash is equal to this piece's computed hash;
      void clearBlocks()
      Sets all true values for blocks[] to false (used to set this piece for redownload if hash verification failed)
      byte[] computeHash()
      Computes SHA-1 hash for this piece
      void decrementPeerCount()
      Decrements for this piece by one; This method is synchronized for thread safety
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object object) 
      byte[] getBytes(int offset, int size)
      Reads an array of bytes form the file that this piece is written too
      int getDownloadAttempts()
      Gets the number of attempts that have been made to download this piece, a piece may have multiple attempts if one or more attempts have failed to verify its SHA-1 hash
      byte[] getHash()
      Gets the SHA-1 hash of the completed piece as a byte array
      int getIndex()
      Gets the integer index of the piece
      Block getNextBlock()
      Gets the next block that has not yet been downloaded and is not locked by another thread.
      int getOffset()
      Gets the file offset in bytes of the begining of where this piece begins
      int getPeerCount()
      Gets the number of peers that currently have this piece
      int getSize() 
      void incrementAttempts()
      Increases the number of download attempts made by one; This method is synchronized for thread saftey
      void incrementPeerCount()
      Increments the for this piece by one; This method is synchronized for thread safety
      boolean isComplete()
      Checks whether the piece is completely downloaded
      void setComplete()
      Sets all blocks to downloaded and sets completed to true
      void setHash(byte[] hash) 
      void writeBlock(byte[] message)
      Writes the payload of the given message to the download file

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece(int index,
     int size,
     int offset,
     java.io.File file,
     byte[] hash)
      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Creates a new piece object with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        index - Zero based index of the piece relative to other pieces of the file
        size - Size the piece in bytes
        offset - The offset to the begining of this piece in the file, in bytes
        file - the file to which this piece is to be saved
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

        Checks whether the piece is completely downloaded
        Returns:
        True if piece is complete, otherwise false

      • getHash

        public byte[] getHash()
        Gets the SHA-1 hash of the completed piece as a byte array
        Returns:

      • getOffset

        public int getOffset()
        Gets the file offset in bytes of the begining of where this piece begins
        Returns:
        File offset in bytes

      • getDownloadAttempts

        public int getDownloadAttempts()
        Gets the number of attempts that have been made to download this piece, a piece may have multiple attempts if one or more attempts have failed to verify its SHA-1 hash
        Returns:
        Number of attempts at downloading this piece

      • getNextBlock

        public Block getNextBlock()
        Gets the next block that has not yet been downloaded and is not locked by another thread. If such a block exists the lock on that block is acquired before returning
        Returns:
        the next to be downloaded, null if no block is available
        Throws:
        BtException

        Gets the number of peers that currently have this piece

                   throws java.io.IOException
        Computes SHA-1 hash for this piece

                throws BtException,
                       java.io.IOException
        Writes the payload of the given message to the download file
        Parameters:
        message - message with payload to be written to file
        Throws:

      • checkHash

        public boolean checkHash()

      • checkHash

        public boolean checkHash(byte[] hash)
        Checks if a given hash is equal to this piece's computed hash;
        Parameters:
        hash - the SHA-1 hash that this piece is supposed to have
        Returns:
        True if hashes match, otherwise false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • clearBlocks

        public void clearBlocks()
        Sets all true values for blocks[] to false (used to set this piece for redownload if hash verification failed)

              int size)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Reads an array of bytes form the file that this piece is written too
        Parameters:

        size - the number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        an array of bytes read from the file
